title: Variables: Master variable declarations and scope

task.title: Variable Scope Challenge
task.problemStatement: Create a program demonstrating function scope, block scope, and global scope. Declare variables using var, let, and const in different scopes and explain the differences in their accessibility.

challenges.title: Function Scope vs Block Scope
challenges.description: Write a function that demonstrates the difference between function-scoped var and block-scoped let/const variables inside if statements and loops.

challenges.title: Variable Hoisting
challenges.description: Create examples showing how var hoisting differs from let/const temporal dead zone behavior.

challenges.title: Scope Chain
challenges.description: Build nested functions that access variables from parent scopes to demonstrate the scope chain concept.

title: Constants: Working with const and immutability

task.title: Const vs Let Immutability
task.problemStatement: Demonstrate the difference between const immutability and mutable references. Show how const prevents reassignment but allows mutation of objects and arrays.

challenges.title: Immutable Objects with Object.freeze()
challenges.description: Create an object with Object.freeze() and attempt to modify its properties to understand true immutability.

challenges.title: Const Array Mutation
challenges.description: Declare a const array and demonstrate that you can modify its elements and add/remove items without reassigning.

challenges.title: Deep Immutability Pattern
challenges.description: Create a function that prevents modification of nested objects in a const object structure.

task.title: Complete Datatype Survey
task.problemStatement: Create a comprehensive program that demonstrates all JavaScript primitive types (string, number, boolean, null, undefined, symbol, bigint) and object type with practical examples.

challenges.title: Type Checking with typeof
challenges.description: Write a function that checks and logs the type of various values including edge cases like typeof null and typeof arrays.

challenges.title: BigInt Operations
challenges.description: Perform arithmetic operations with BigInt values and compare them with regular numbers to understand their differences.

challenges.title: Symbol Uniqueness
challenges.description: Create multiple symbols and demonstrate their uniqueness by comparing them and using them as object keys.

task.title: Type Coercion Mastery
task.problemStatement: Build a program demonstrating implicit and explicit type conversions. Show how JavaScript automatically converts types in different contexts and how to manually convert between types.

challenges.title: String to Number Conversions
challenges.description: Use Number(), parseInt(), parseFloat(), and unary + operator to convert strings and demonstrate their differences.

challenges.title: Implicit Coercion in Operations
challenges.description: Demonstrate how JavaScript implicitly coerces types when using +, -, *, / operators with mixed types.

challenges.title: Truthy and Falsy Values
challenges.description: Create a comprehensive list of all falsy values and demonstrate how they behave in boolean contexts.

task.title: Object Manipulation Suite
task.problemStatement: Create objects using literal, constructor, and Object.create() methods. Demonstrate property addition, deletion, modification, and iteration over object properties.

challenges.title: Object Literal vs Constructor
challenges.description: Create the same object structure using both object literal syntax and constructor function, then compare their behavior.

challenges.title: Property Descriptors
challenges.description: Use Object.defineProperty() to create properties with specific configurations like writable, enumerable, and configurable flags.

challenges.title: Object Iteration Methods
challenges.description: Iterate through an object using for...in, Object.keys(), Object.values(), and Object.entries() and explain the differences.

task.title: Array Methods Comprehensive
task.problemStatement: Demonstrate array manipulation using methods like push, pop, map, filter, reduce, find, forEach, sort, and slice. Build a practical program that uses at least 5 different array methods.

challenges.title: Map vs ForEach vs Reduce
challenges.description: Transform an array of numbers using map() to double values, use forEach() to print them, and reduce() to find the sum. Understand when to use each method.

challenges.title: Filter and Find Combined
challenges.description: Create an array of student objects and use filter() to find all students above 80% score, then use find() to locate the first student named 'John'.

challenges.title: Array Sorting and Comparison
challenges.description: Sort an array of objects by multiple properties and implement custom sort comparators for complex data structures.

task.title: Function Fundamentals
task.problemStatement: Create functions using regular declaration, function expression, and arrow functions. Demonstrate parameters, return values, default parameters, and rest parameters.

challenges.title: Function Declaration vs Expression
challenges.description: Demonstrate hoisting differences between function declarations and function expressions with practical examples.

challenges.title: Parameters and Arguments
challenges.description: Create functions with default parameters, rest parameters (...args), and destructured parameters to handle flexible argument passing.

challenges.title: First-Class Functions
challenges.description: Demonstrate that functions are first-class objects by passing them as arguments and returning them from other functions.

task.title: Operator Classification
task.problemStatement: Create a comprehensive overview program categorizing all JavaScript operators: arithmetic, assignment, comparison, logical, bitwise, ternary, and special operators with examples.

challenges.title: Operator Categories
challenges.description: Create objects categorizing different types of operators and demonstrate at least two examples for each category.

challenges.title: Special Operators
challenges.description: Explore typeof, instanceof, in, delete, and spread (...) operators with practical use cases.

challenges.title: Operator Combinations
challenges.description: Show how combining multiple operators affects program behavior and readability.

task.title: Arithmetic Operations Suite
task.problemStatement: Demonstrate all arithmetic operators (+, -, *, /, %, **) with various number types. Build a simple calculator that handles different operations.

challenges.title: Modulo Operations
challenges.description: Use the modulo operator (%) to check for even/odd numbers, create cycles, and solve real-world remainder problems.

challenges.title: Exponentiation
challenges.description: Use the exponentiation operator (**) to calculate powers, square roots, and solve mathematical problems.

challenges.title: Increment/Decrement Operators
challenges.description: Demonstrate prefix (++i) vs postfix (i++) increment operators and explain their behavioral differences.

task.title: Assignment Operations Comprehensive
task.problemStatement: Explore all assignment operators (=, +=, -=, *=, /=, %=, **=, etc.) and demonstrate how compound assignments simplify code.

challenges.title: Compound Assignment Conversions
challenges.description: Refactor a program using simple assignments to use compound assignment operators and verify the results are identical.

challenges.title: Assignment with Type Coercion
challenges.description: Demonstrate how compound operators handle type coercion, especially += with mixed types.

challenges.title: Destructuring Assignment
challenges.description: Use destructuring assignment with objects and arrays to unpack values into distinct variables.

task.title: Comparison Operations Mastery
task.problemStatement: Demonstrate all comparison operators (<, >, <=, >=) with various data types and understand how JavaScript compares different types.

challenges.title: Numeric Comparisons
challenges.description: Compare numbers, strings that look like numbers, and mixed types to understand comparison behavior.

challenges.title: String Comparisons
challenges.description: Compare strings lexicographically and understand how JavaScript orders characters.

challenges.title: Complex Comparisons
challenges.description: Create a function that compares objects and arrays by value rather than reference.

task.title: Equality Operators Deep Dive
task.problemStatement: Compare loose (==) and strict (===) equality operators. Demonstrate type coercion in loose equality and best practices for using each.

challenges.title: Loose Equality Quirks
challenges.description: Create examples showing unexpected results from loose equality comparisons due to type coercion.

challenges.title: Inequality Operators
challenges.description: Demonstrate the differences between != and !== with various data types.

challenges.title: Equality with Objects and Arrays
challenges.description: Show how equality operators handle object and array comparisons and why reference comparison matters.

task.title: Ternary Operator Applications
task.problemStatement: Master the ternary operator for conditional expressions. Create practical examples replacing if-else statements with ternary operators and nested ternary patterns.

challenges.title: Simple Ternary Conversions
challenges.description: Convert several if-else statements to single-line ternary operators.

challenges.title: Nested Ternary Operators
challenges.description: Create a multi-condition logic using nested ternary operators and determine grade based on multiple score ranges.

challenges.title: Ternary in JSX Context
challenges.description: Demonstrate ternary operator usage in rendering conditional UI elements (simulate JSX-like scenarios).

task.title: Logical Operators Advanced
task.problemStatement: Explore AND (&&), OR (||), and NOT (!) operators. Demonstrate short-circuit evaluation and practical use cases in conditional logic.

challenges.title: Short-Circuit Evaluation
challenges.description: Demonstrate how && and || use short-circuit evaluation to skip unnecessary computations.

challenges.title: Logical Operators for Defaults
challenges.description: Use || operator to set default values and && operator to conditionally execute code without if statements.

challenges.title: Complex Boolean Logic
challenges.description: Create complex conditional expressions combining multiple logical operators and demonstrate operator precedence.

task.title: Logical Operators with Type Coercion
task.problemStatement: Demonstrate how logical operators work with non-boolean values through truthy/falsy type coercion. Show the actual returned values from && and || operators.

challenges.title: Truthy/Falsy Returns
challenges.description: Show that && and || return actual values, not just true/false, and demonstrate this behavior with various types.

challenges.title: Default Value Patterns
challenges.description: Use logical operators to implement default value patterns and the nullish coalescing operator (??) comparison.

challenges.title: Complex Type Coercion Chain
challenges.description: Create a chain of logical operators with mixed types to demonstrate coercion precedence and results.

task.title: Bitwise Operations Fundamentals
task.problemStatement: Explore bitwise operators (&, |, ^, ~, <<, >>, >>>) and their practical applications. Demonstrate bit manipulation techniques.

challenges.title: Basic Bitwise Operations
challenges.description: Perform AND, OR, XOR, and NOT operations on binary numbers and visualize their results.

challenges.title: Bit Shifting
challenges.description: Use left shift (<<) and right shift (>>, >>>) operators to multiply/divide by powers of 2 and perform bit extraction.

challenges.title: Bitwise Tricks
challenges.description: Implement practical bitwise tricks like checking if a number is power of 2, swapping variables without temp, and toggling bits.

task.title: Operator Precedence Comprehensive
task.problemStatement: Create a program demonstrating JavaScript operator precedence. Show how operators are evaluated in specific order and how parentheses override precedence.

challenges.title: Precedence Demonstrations
challenges.description: Create multiple expressions showing how operator precedence affects results, with and without parentheses.

challenges.title: Associativity Rules
challenges.description: Demonstrate left-to-right and right-to-left associativity for operators like assignment and exponentiation.

challenges.title: Complex Expression Evaluation
challenges.description: Analyze and predict results of complex expressions combining arithmetic, logical, comparison, and bitwise operators.

task.title: Conditional Logic Structures
task.problemStatement: Master if-else, else-if chains, and nested conditionals. Build a practical program with multiple conditional branches for different scenarios.

challenges.title: Grade Determination System
challenges.description: Create a grading system using if-else-if chains that assigns grades based on score ranges (A: 90+, B: 80+, C: 70+, etc.)

challenges.title: Nested Conditionals
challenges.description: Build a nested conditional structure for a login validation system checking age, account status, and credentials.

challenges.title: Refactoring with Switch
challenges.description: Convert complex if-else chains to switch statements when appropriate and understand when each is better suited.
